Reflects the gross carrying amount of unpaid loans pertaining to a revolving line of credit used by mortgage bankers in which the mortgage banker originates and purchases mortgage loans due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Includes completed real estate projects or land for sale in their present condition that have met all of the "held for sale" criteria of the "Property, Plant and Equipment" Topic of the Financial Accounting Standards Board Accounting Standards Codification (Topic 360) and other assets directly related to such projects. Real estate held for sale is recorded at the lower of cost or fair value less cost to sell. If an asset's fair value less cost to sell, based on discounted future cash flows, management estimates or market comparisons, is less than its carrying amount, an allowance is recorded against the asset.
Real estate that is in the process of being developed that is expected to be completed and disposed of more than one year of the balance sheet date. Real estate under development is carried at cost.

Land on which development activities have not yet commenced and completed assets or land held for disposition that do not meet the "held for sale" criteria of the "Property, Plant and Equipment" Topic of the Financial Accounting Standards Board Accounting Standards Codification (Topic 360). Real estate held for investment is carried at cost less depreciation and amortization, as applicable.

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable such as commissions payable to brokers and other outside parties, as well as obligations related to services received from employees, including accrued salaries, vacation, payroll taxes and fringe benefits. All of these liabilities are due within one year of the balance sheet date.
Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of the portions of notes payable associated with current real estate assets or that are due within one year of the balance sheet date.

Liabilities associated with completed real estate projects or land for sale in their present condition that have met all of the "held for sale" criteria of the "Property, Plant and Equipment" Topic of the Financial Accounting Standards Board Accounting Standards Codification (Topic 360) and other assets directly related to such projects. Such liabilities generally include notes payable on real estate held for sale, accounts payable and accrued expenses and other current liabilities.
Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of the portions of notes payable associated with real estate assets, which are due more than one year of the balance sheet date.
